p.span: The mission of the Alton School District is to prepare our students with college, career and citizenship skills through a safe and progressive learning environment.

span.span: Alton School District Students, Parents and Families,
Today, Governor J.B. Pritzker announced the closure of Illinois schools will now extend through the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year.
This is certainly not the end to the school year we hoped for, but student and staff safety are our continued priorities.

As a result, the school calendar will be adjusted. May 8 will remain the last day for Alton High Seniors. The last day for all other students will now be May 15. This is a change as the district will now be utilizing May 18 thru May 22 as Remote Planning Days provided by the Illinois State Board of Education. During this final week, teachers and staff will be finalizing grades, meeting as teams, developing extended learning plans for students and other school closure-related activities.

Please know that between now and May 15, remote learning will continue to take place each day. It is VERY IMPORTANT that your child continues to connect with his/her teacher regularly and complete assigned instructional activities. There is a significant and valid concern about the lost instructional time (equating to nearly 25% of the school year) students have experienced as a result of the school closure. Therefore, we need your help keeping your student focused and motivated so that learning continues through May 15. Let’s finish strong!

Our school teams will be working over the coming weeks to plan extended learning options (ex. summer school, early start programs, interventions) to provide students in need with opportunities to recover lost instructional time.

Finally, we ask that you continue to keep our Alton High Seniors in your thoughts. These outstanding soon-to-be graduates are experiencing a sudden and abrupt end to their final year of high school. What was supposed to be a time of celebration has now suddenly been placed on hold. The Class of 2020 is an outstanding group of young men and women and we could not be prouder of their accomplishments. We ask you to join us in acknowledging their unique ability to triumph in these ever-changing circumstances. We wish them the very best in all of their future endeavors.
Thank you! Stay Safe! Stay Well!

td.span: The Alton School District Remote Learning Plan is implemented during emergency situations when the closure of schools is either necessary or mandated by state/federal agencies. The purpose of this plan is to provide students with resources to support continuous learning outside of the school. This plan respects the diverse and varying needs of all students. The content for remote learning is aligned to state standards, relevant and appropriate for each student. Consistent and ongoing communication with a student's teacher, through multiple methods, is also a critical focus of the plan.

span.strong: Click the image to the right to access the ACUSD#11 Remote Learning Plan.

strong.u: The Alton School District will continue to:

li.span: Provide students with breakfast/lunch bags over the extended closure.
Communicate updates as they become known (email, social media, phone dialer and website).· Engage students academically and socially with the assistance of our teachers and staff.
Teachers will continue to be available to parents and/or students between 8:00 am and 12:00 pm, Monday-Friday.
Contact your child’s teacher via email, Skyward message or a communication app they have designated (DoJo, Remind App, Google Classroom or other)
Contact your child’s principal via email for the quickest response or call 474-2600.
Parents/guardians and older students should check email often to watch for messages from the school district, schools, principals and teachers.

p.span: All extracurricular activities and sports practices are suspended until further notice.
The Administrative Center is open for essential business only and access to our schools is restricted with the exception of picking up food bags for students.

Please know we continue to focus on ensuring students receive proper nutrition, providing regular communication for your family and engaging our students through alternate learning resources over the extended closure. Please take care of each other and know we are here for the duration should you need us. Stay home and stay safe. Thank you.

b.i: IMPORTANT CHANGE: Neighborhood Food Distribution for Students

span.b: The Alton School District will be changing our food distribution days to Mondays and Thursdays ONLY. This will allow the district to provide students with 7 days of food instead of just 5 days.
On Mondays, students will be provided with a three-day breakfast/lunch bag followed by a four-day bag on Thursdays each week.
This change in service will begin on Thursday, March 26.
The school pick-up and neighborhood bus locations will all remain the same.
This includes Mondays and Thursdays from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm at AHS, AMS, East, North, and West
